p: Previously, the methanol and dichloromethane extracts of K. folosia as well as dimeric anthraquinones, knipholone and dianellin isolated therefrom have been shown to have in vitro activity against chloroquine-resistant (W2) and chloroquine-sensitive (D6 and 3D7) strains of P. falciparum [ 16, 17]. The ED 50 of knipholone (1.49 μg/ml) against 3D7 strains [ 16] was much lower than that of dianellin which showed IC 50 values of 3.14 and 5.47 µg/ml against W2 and D6 strains, respectively [ 17]. In addition, knipholone isolated from Bulbine capitata and Bulbine frutescens has been reported to possess in vitro activity against chloroquine-resistant (K1) and chloroquine-sensitive (NF54) strains with IC 50 values of 1.06 and 1.7 µM, respectively [ 44, 45].
